CatDescriptText: Mrs. Bernice Dennis, housewife, 1126 Adams Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 11, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe churches of any denomination receive appreciation financial help from racketeers?" answer reads:  with question: "Do you believe churches of any denomination receive appreciation financial help from racketeers?" answer reads: "Indirectly, a lot of them do.  Directly, I don't think they should and I don't believe that they do.  You know it to be a fact that most ministers don't condone the rackets.  However, racket money comes into the church sometimes during special fund drives.  This is because solicitors, in getting contributions, go unknowingly to some persons who are racketeers.  However, I say that if the church solicitor knows that the money is coming from a racketeer, he should not accept it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bernice Dennis, wearing hat with bow, dark coat, and light colored mid length gloves, holding magazine and handbag, standing with reporter holding notepad, gathered in front of store window with pastry display and signs that read "Blackeye Peas 19c 35c" and "Soup 3 for 29c"
